content:
I'm working on a new Backdrop distribution I call OpenKratia (https://github.com/OpenKratia/openkratia). It will be a digital platform to help organizations to make their decisions making process more participative and democratic. I am still working on the code, but if any one is interested in this project, please, come forward. I'll be more than happy to helped ;-). Thanks

OpenKratia/openkratia
Source code of OpenKratia. Contribute to OpenKratia/openkratia development by creating an account on GitHub.
I'm super interested in this. I have a strong background in e-democracy, but haven't been doing that work for the last few years. I'd love to work on a project like this.
@Robert Garrigos - Do you clients/users for this already? Or are you building it first.

building first, although i have some possible users to offer them to test it. You are more than welcome to work on this. Do you know decidim.org? they have a demo it would give you a good sense of what I'm thinking of, at least in terms of content types and relations.
I had not seen that tool. However, I logged in and took a look today. Looks like a useful product.
Might be good to pick just one or two key features to work on first?
I'll try to look closer at decidim tonight or tomorrow.

StPaulTim said:

Might be good to pick just one or two key features to work on first?

Yes, I'm working on a couple of spaces (the name comes from here: https://decidim.org/features/) and 4-5 components. Spaces and components will be pluggable, so more would come later.

More here on decidim's structure, which I like and try to replicate (partially, at least): https://docs.decidim.org/features/en/general-description/
It does. It is very powerful. We might simplify it very much.
